When Louis saw the infamously impractical J.J Abrams crossguard lightsaber appear on screen, he heard an ominous and creepy voice that sounded suspiciously like Emperor Palpatine speak to him inside his head. In a commanding, scary, domineering way, this phantom, spectral voice said “YOU WILL KILL LUKE SKYWALKER”.

Louis, being a preeminent Star Wars geek, knew the origin of that phrase immediately. It was the telepathic command the Emperor had given to Mara Jade in The Thrawn Trilogy. Not very creative or erudite of Palpatine, who was one of the smartest beings in the Star Wars galaxy, but it got the point across clearly. The real question is, why would Louis be thinking such a random thought like that right now?

“Guess I'm just nervous” he rationalized to himself, yet he was still slightly worried.

As Louis pondered the meaning of his oncoming schizophrenia, more changes to his body took place. By the time the preview footage had ended and the lights had come back on in the auditorium to the thunderous applause and geeky squeals of hundreds of dedicated science fiction fans, Louis now possessed a slender, sexy, feminine hourglass figure. One that Brittany or any woman would be jealous of. If only he weren't still a man.

The trousers of Louis's white Admiral uniform had lengthened, tightened around his lower body, and changed its cut until it prominently displayed his new curvaceous rear end, and his now long and slender, toned athletic legs. The suit jacket and undershirt had been magically re-cut to accommodate his new figure as well. From behind, Louis now looked more like a girl who was Rule 63ing Grand Admiral Thrawn but forgot to cut her hair rather than a male Thrawn cosplayer.

Brittany took one look at her new “friend” and did a double take, mouth agape. She grabbed Angela's hand and took her aside.

“Sis, I think there's something you ought to know.”

“Ohmigod, Brit, did you see that lightwhip!? They may have Lady Lumiya in this thing!”

Angela's eyes were pratically bulging out her eyes like a clingy girlfriend, and she was starting to hyperventilate, her chest going up and down rhythmically.

“Sis, I loved it too, but I just had a major epiphany about myself.”

Angela's face suddenly stopped grinning profusely and in a flash became one of concern.

“What is it?” asked Angela.

“I think I'm kinda gay.”

Angela looked over at her older sibling.

“Seriously?”

“Yeah. I think it's why I've had so many failed relationships with boyfriends over the years. None of them ever worked out, and I could never figure out why, but it's all damned clear now. I've always been more attracted to women, but I just didn't get it until just this second.”

Angela looked over at Louis, who was trying and failing to flirt with the girl with the camera, and then back over at her sister. She smiled.

“Who'd a thunk it? Instead of Luke and Mara Jade Skywalker, it's Leia and Mara Jade Skywalker. Poor Han. All he has is Lando and Chewie now.”

“Actually, Chewie dies in Vector Prime, the first book in the New Jedi Order series” corrected Brittany. “And Lando got married at some point, I think. Han is stuck listening to C-3PO whine about his problems” whimpered Brittany, now staring lustfully at Louis's perfectly round bubble butt and narrow waist. The girl with the camera handed Louis a piece a paper with her phone number on it, and walked away backwards, staring at him.

“Don't worry about the teenybopper, Brit” consoled Angela. “The magic spell guarantees that Louis will be yours and yours alone”.

“I hope so” she said skeptically. “Anyways, what about that bitching looking new Star Destroyer? Now I know what I want for next Christmas!”

He was too enraptured with the scene going on in front of him. A Star Trek nerd, who apparently was named Joe, had started a massive shit storm with his new friend Brittany Peters.

“You're just a fake geek girl like the rest of them” he spat. “I don't care how old you are.”

“Bullcrap, nerd. I bet that I've forgotten more about Star Trek then you'll ever know.”

“Yeah, right” he said sarcastically. “If you were such a Trek fan, you wouldn't betray your brothers and sisters in uniform by dressing up as the Princess who had sex with her brother.”

“First of all, fuck you. Leia never had sex with anyone but Han Solo. Second, dude, you weren't even alive when The Original Series first aired in syndication. I was. I can recite the dialogue from every single episode. I can quote verbatim from every movie and most of the other series of shows. I'm a huge Trekker, I just happen to like Star Wars a little bit more. Show some respect to an elder fan.”

“A real Star Trek fan wouldn't call themselves a Trekker!” rebutted Joe.

Brittany rolled her eyes and flipped Joe the bird.

“Star Wars is childish space opera. It's all bullshit. Darth Vader is a whiny brat. Palpatine is a ripoff of Ming the Merciless and should be a Game of Thrones characters instead, and Luke and Leia definitely committed incest. And besides, Q would obliterate any Wars characters with a snap of his fingers. Darth Vader? He's nothing compared to the Continuum.”

Brittany and Joe got into a mile a minute, motor mouthed debate over miscellaneous trivia, each citing ridiculously obscure ST/SW facts and getting red in the face when the other person didn't know something. Joe was no slouch in the department of minutia, but Brittany, who had been on this Earth far longer than Joe had been and thus had absorbed that much more pointless knowledge about a pair of fictional universes that could never happen in real life, was clearly winning. She even impressed her sister Angela, who up until this point thought that she was the queen of nerddom in this town, but now was considering conceding the position to Brittany. Louis was simply amazed, and impressed at his new best friend. When Brittany and “Joe”, who had had his ears surgically altered to look just like Mr. Spock's, had gotten to close to one another and looked like they were around to trade blows, Angela finally stepped in.

“Joe, how many times have you seen Wrath of Khan?”

“78 times for the first one, and 32 times for Into Darkness.”

“Did you like Into Darkness?”

“Yeah, I loved it. Benedict Cumberbatch was actually an improvement, I thought. I can't wait to see him kill it as Doctor Strange.”

“Brittany, how many times have you seen it?”

“I've seen it a hundred times. I watched Into Darkness exactly one time. The ending was complete bullshit.”

Brittany than listed a thorough itinerary of reasons why she felt that way, including a breakdown of why the deus ex machina of how Kirk was brought back to life will kill the franchise. All the arguments were beautifully eloquent and well reasoned.

“I rest my case” said Angela.

The crowd that had gathered around the nerdy face-off started clapping. One of them had recorded the entire debate with their Android phone, and would later put in onto Youtube with the title “LEIA vs SPOCK FREESTYLE”.

A few people had gone up to shake Brittany's hands and take pictures with her after her victory, while the loser Joe slunk off in humiliated defeat.


“I think you need a little change in perspective, pal” said Angela, touching Joe's left shoulder. He felt a sudden jolt of cold burst through his chest.

“What the hell did you d...” whispered Joe, who couldn't finish his sentence. He found an alcove and passed out on the floor.

**

When Joe regained consciousness, he noticed a Haitian looking security standing over him.

“Miss, this isn't a Comic Book convention, it's a Star Wars convention. Please try to dress appropriately.”

“Are you talking to me?” asked Joe in a high pitched songlike voice.

“Yeah, I'm talking to you. Are there any other Catwoman cosplayers here?”

“Catwoman?”

Joe looked down at his chest, and saw two enormous breasts protruding out of a black vinyl costume. Near his right hip was a black whip. Twenty feet away was a mirror affixed to a wall. Getting up, Joe sashayed up to it, but he didn't need to see his face to recognize that he was now much thinner and curvier than he had been a second ago.

When he approached the mirror, Joe took the Catwoman mask off, and suddenly a trail of long, wavy blonde hair fell out. The face staring at Joe in the mirror was older than he was by more than a few years. He suspected she was in her late thirties or even early forties, but she was still hot in a MILFy kind of way, and she obviously kept in good shape. Her skin was extremely fair, which contrasted well with her ruby red lipstick and the dramatic eye makeup she wore. She was clearly trying to emulate the Michelle Pfeiffer version of Selina Kyle than the more recent Anne Hathaway one, but Joe always liked Pfeiffer's Catwoman more anyway. He fapped to her so much when Batman Returns had come out.

Two women, obviously more fake geek girls thought Joe, were rushing towards him. Both of them were dressed up in TOS costumes, one of them cosplaying as Nyota Uhura and the other as Janice Rand.

“Josie, I'm sorry we're late! Here's your Saavik costume.”

The Uhura cosplayer handed Joe a plastic bag filled with a Starfleet uniform, Vulcan ears, and a brown wig.

“You better go change before the costume judging starts!” yelled the giddy lady, practically shoving the bag into Joe's hands.

The second woman, who was cosplaying as Janice Rand, grabbed Joe's hand with an excess of fangirlish excitement, practically skipping into the ladies room with Joe being dragged behind.

“I'm sorry you had to go as Catwoman, Jo.”

“Yeah...I'm sorry too” he said, not believing what had happened to him. He had to go find those two women dressed as Padme and Leia, and he had to do it soon, lest he be trapped as “Josie” forever.

The Janice Rand cosplayer, who Joe had picked up was named Hildy, helped him out of the form fitting Catwoman costume and into the more comfortable costume of Saavik from “Wrath Of Khan”.

Joe's vision began to blur out of focus like his life was playing on an overheated film projector.

“Oh my god, am I going blind!?” worried Joe out loud. He was worried that one of the two new friends of his would hear him, but neither of them, nor anybody else, uttered a peep.

For a moment, there was nothing was darkness, and when the darkness faded, Joe was no longer at the convention.

Instead, he was in someone's kitchen, watching a little toe head girl in pigtails and pajamas, no more than eight, reading an old issue of Marvel Star Wars(“Adventures Beyond The Greatest Space-Fantasy Film Of All!”) on the wooden breakfast table while she slowly took bites of Freakies cereal, slurping the milk in her mouth as she swallowed it.

“Josie! Stop that!” yelled a stomping woman, the click clacks of her heels able to be heard a mile away on the checkered linoleum floor. Her fashion and hairstyle were straight out of the mid-70s, which come to think of it, so was the décor of this kitchen.

Joe stood there, mouth agape, as neither child nor parent seemed to realize that he was there.

“Honestly, you have the manners of a pig. You can read this after you've had your breakfast” scolded the mother, removing the offending four color magazine from her daughter's purview. Then she walked away, presumably into the living quarters, her click clacks following behind her.

“Mommy! Please! I was just getting to the good par-” whined the little girl, distracted in mid sentence as she suddenly went back to her sugary cereal, continuing to slurp her milk, just very quietly, now staring out the window as the sun rose over the neighborhood houses. Joe could tell somehow that she was daydreaming about something, perhaps some space adventures of her own.

**

Joe was confused. Was this supposed to be Josie as a little girl? He was gaining her memories now!? Joe worried that that would mean he would lose his own memories of himself, just as he had lost his identity. But before he could dwell on it for too long, the scene ended, only for poor Joe to be brought back to “reality” where Hildy and Brianna were dragging him along, showing Joe a scaled down replica of Darth Vader's personal ship, the Executor. Both women scoffed, Hildy even tapping the well designed reproduction with her index finger in a clearly dismissive fashion, and then made some snarky comment about it that Joe wasn't paying attention to.

Which bothered Joe. Normally, he'd be the first person to snark at anything to do with Star Wars. He hated that franchise with every fiber of his being for, in his eyes, overshadowing the true greatest space opera in American sci-fi history, Wagon Train To The Stars...oops, I meant Star Trek.

These new feelings of nostalgia for the franchise that Joe had spent countless hours detesting and deconstructing both online and with his friends(Fellow hard core Trekkies) confused him. Now he had some kind of appreciation for them. Maybe, thought Joe, Star Wars wasn't as good as Trek at its best was, but both franchises have their rightful place at the table of sci-fi/fantasy fandom. Oh no, maybe Josie's memories were overtaking his! He now remembered watching the Original Trilogy in their re-releases so many times with a family that was not his own. Not that...that woman who took away his...took away that little girl's comic book, because he now recalled that she detested the entire genre of speculative fiction, finding it a distraction from real world issues. She wanted her daughters to grow up to become intellectuals or political activists, not socially stunted space opera groupies. Joe instead watched the girl walking into a movie theater that night with a strange man who he recalled being his father...but it wasn't Joe's father! He remembered this man taking him and another person to see Star Wars(Not yet entitled Episode IV)...his, oh no, his older sister Martha! Martha Macelroy! She was about fourteen or fifteen here. Pretty, in a gazelle kind of way, minus the braces on her teeth. She was a bit too skinny for Joe's taste too.

Martha Macelroy. She was a middle aged Youtube star and podcaster with an audience that rivaled big name stars that Joe had gotten into many flame wars with over the years. He had first met her at the 2000 San Diego Comic Con, where she was pleasant enough, but as the years rolled on, Joe had found more and more to disagree with her about. She had her own website, where Joe had frequented the message boards, looking to debate this, that, and the other thing, before being permabanned as a troll.

Now they were...sisters?

He has these new friends who may or may not have also been created from essentially nothing, he was now married (oh god, that thought again!) and he was now the sister of one of the biggest nerd stars on Youtube, a star that in his previous life he had absolutely despised.

There had to be some way out of this. He had to say something to Hildy and Brianna. He had to find some way to get back to Angela and Brittany and demand his life back. He had to…

Suddenly, life got out of focus again. Darkness took over. Joe's body kept moving, but his mind was somewhere else.

Now Joe found himself on the playground of a school. It was recess, and many kids were running around, playing tag, football, and various other activities.

Except one person. One girl, to be exact. An older version of the one he saw in the previous vision. She was sitting in the curb, taking in a battered up issue of Marvel Preview #4, which Joe noted to be the first appearance of Star Lord. Wait, had he known that previously, or was this a comic book fact Josie knew that Joe didn't? He knew he was losing his mind, but now it was scarier to not know which parts of his mind he was actually losing.

Joe was broken out of his attempts to connect himself back to his previous reality when he noticed two boys approaching the sitting girl. What was going on? Joe went closer to investigate.

"Hey there. What're you doing?" said one of the boys, the facetiousness in his voice absolutely dripping.

The girl looked up, a little fear in her eyes. "I'm… reading."

"That's a comic book, right?" asked the second boy.

"Y…Yes… It's a Marvel…" The girl continued.

"Don't you know that little girls aren't allowed the read comic books? They'll just get their cooties all over them." The first boy said, before snatching the book out of her hands.

"He..Hey! Give that back!" The girl pleaded.

"Hmm… What should we do with this?" The boy said to his pal as he flipped through the book.

"We could throw it. Or set on fire later." The other boy said.

"No! Stop! Give it back!" The girl shouted.

"Nah, why wait to do anything? I think we should just rip it apart now." The first boy proclaimed.

"NO! Please!" The girl shouted on deaf ears, tears now escaping from her face.

"Give it back to her right now!" another female voice shouted.

Everyone at the scene, including Joe, turned to see a blonde girl who was rather tall for her young age, with a scowl on her face. Joe gasped. It was the young Hildy.

"Yeah? Or else what?" The boy holding the book said in a taunting tone.

"You know or else what. I'll go tell Mrs. Schumacher!" Young Hildy shouted.

Joe noted that the two boys looked at each other, each trying to hide the fear in their eyes. Was Mrs. Schumacher tough or something? Or… did she also turn boys into women? Was this something that had been going on in this town?

Whatever the case was, Joe saw the two boys turn back to the original girl as they toss the book back. The young girl caught it right before it hit the concrete and began to flip through it again. Without a word, the boys walked away.

"Yeah, you better run!" Young Hildy screamed. Turning back, she approached the young girl who was checking her comic.

"Everything OK? If it's ruined in any way, I know a place we can get you another one." Young Hildy says.

"It… it looks fine." The little girl said, wiping away some tears. "Thanks…"

"Don't mention it. Don't pay attention to those meatheads. Comics are for everyone, not just stupid boys." Young Hildy said.

The young girl nodded and smiled.

"Me and my friend are heading to a comic shop to see if we can find Mrs. Marvel after school. You wanna come?" Young Hildy said.

"I'd… have to ask my mom, but I would love to." The young girl said.

"OK. I hope you can come. My name is Hilda Henderson, by the way. You can just call me Hildy though."

"My name is…" The young girl started to say, before the vision faded again.
___________________________

As Josie once again returned to reality, and returned to the comic con floor. He looked to Hildy, then to Brianna, whom he somehow knew was the other friend Hildy mentioned. He thought back to those boys that had taken the comics. They were such jerks! Wait, was he that kind of jerk? All the arguments and call outs and out downs the old Joe had made over the years. Did he really look that stupid and idiotic?

Was this the whole point of the change? Was this some sort of Comic Book Christmas Carol where he learned the true meaning of fandom and all that jazz? Maybe he could find Angela and Brittany and that other… boy… to prove to them that he had learned his lesson and changed and he could go back to being… a boy.

Joe didn't fully realize it yet, but his mind was going all over the place. There was a growing part of Joe that was feeling for Josie, and was becoming Josie. He listened to Hildy and Brianna talk about a cool piece of Green Lantern art they just saw as he tried to plot catching up with Angela and Brittany.


Option 1: The visions of the past continue to whizz by as Joe takes a look at highlights from Josie's high school and college years, including meeting Angela and Brittany, and his future husband, Parker.

Option 2: A group of cosplayers come up to Josie and ask for her autograph, revealing that in the new reality she is a co-host of Martha's show, which is one of the most popular podcasts in the show. As they show excitement for the panel Josie and Martha are doing later, Josie's view of Martha starts to shift.

14522121121211212121111111221122111.content:
“Rocksteady is making a Green Lantern game, I can't believe it!” squealed Brianna, showing Hildy the concept artwork.

“It's not going to be as good as their Batman games” replied Hildy dismissively.

“Oh yeah, and how do you figure?” asked Brianna defensively.

“Well for one thing, the Green Lantern mythos suuuucks”

“Bitch, you say that to my face!”

As Hildy and Brianna jokingly fought and debated the merits of the Arkham series of videos games and which Green Lantern character should “headline” the upcoming Rocksteady Green Lantern project, Josie once again started phasing out of our time and into the recesses of the past.

**

When Joe arrived in the not quite ago once again, which was starting to make him a bit nauseous, he saw the two blonde girls from before, one shorter and one taller, enter a cramped but bright and well kept comic book store. Immediately, Joe noticed the smaller one's eyes light up as she looked all around the room.

“Everywhere I look, there's something I want!” thought young Josie giddily.

Somehow, Joe was able to hear her thoughts, which made him increasingly nervous to the idea that Josie's mind was slowly merging with his. Were the Leia chick and her sister witches or something? None of this should be remotely possible. Even in the most out there episodes of Trek would this scenario involving gender benders, time travel, and telepathy be stretching the limits of credulity. He didn't have time to dwell on this latest edition of weirdness, however, as the memory was still playing out in front of him.

Hildy and Josie walked up to Brianna, who was wearing headphones, listening to a mix tape of old Curtis Mayfield songs, picking up one comic after another until she had decided she had enough to tide her over for this week. When she turned around, she saw her friend. She removed the cassette player, put it in her backpack and gave Hildy a big ole' bear hug.

“Josie, this is my friend I told you about, Brianna” said Hildy after letting go. “Brianna, this is Josie, the girl I was telling you about. I wanted to treat her to a trip to our inner sanctum.”

Joe gazed on aloofly as young Josie and young Brianna began to talk about Josie's bullies.

“Honey, my advice would just to stop being a doormat” said Brianna. “Toughen up. Be like Camille Keaton in I Spit On Your Grave.”

Josie's mouth dropped.

“I don't want to kill them!”

Brianna giggled.

“Not literally like her, but you know, don't take crap from boys. Or girls. Or grown ups, or anyone else for that matter.”

A small smirk appeared on Josie's face.

“Thanks. You really cheered me up. Now, if you wouldn't mind” said Josie, making a gesture with her hand to get out of the way of the comics.

Joe could tell that Brianna was not entirely comfortable around Josie just by her somewhat tense and avoidant body language, probably seeing her as a third wheel that was bound to interrupt her and Hildy's private fun time together. A stray alien thought appeared in his headspace that Josie wouldn't become close to Hildy and Brianna for another few months, after Josie had made it a point to befriend them by always going to the comic book store at the same time they did. After their bond was solidified though, the three girls were as thick and thieves, and even into middle age had never had any fallings out with one another or any major drama.

Ultimately, Josie picked out three of everything that caught her fancy: Ms. Marvel, Rom: SpaceKnight, Shogun Warriors, Elf Quest, Hawk & Dove, Heavy Metal, Nick Fury: Agent of S.H.I.E.L.D, Six From Sirius, Dreadstar, X-Men, and some Casper comics to round out the admixture of fantasy, sci-fi, and superhero action.

*****

As Young Josie joyfully skipped out of the comic book shop with her bag of stories after paying for them, Joe decided to follow her out the door, not knowing where else to go. Although the memory was of a bright, sunny day, Joe momentarily found him shrouded in darkness.

“What the hell?” asked Joe, scared at his predicament yet now slightly comfortable with walking around in middle aged Josie's comely female body. He felt something hit him in the face.

“Am I in a basement?” was his first thought.

To test his theory, he grabbed what it was that hit him and pulled down gently. A lightbulb was activated, revealing that this was indeed a basement, and that Joe was at the top of the stairs. The thing that hit him was just the cord that turns it on.

Joe descended the staircase and stepped right into the semi-dark, impermeable cellar, the only exit being the door above the staircase, and a small cellar window shining the luscious light of summertime outside.

“Great, where am I now?” he asked querulously, looking around the surprisingly cavernous bottom floor. When he turned a corner, Joe discovered a group of seven kids playing Dungeons & Dragons, most of them in the middle of adolescence.

One of them was very clearly Josie, who looked even older yet at fourteen, but was still very fresh faced, and was probably the least developed physically of the group. She was smiling, laughing at jokes, giggling, talking a mile a minute, and seemed much better adjusted than the sad, poor little mouse she was in Joe's last vision. She was wearing Spock ears. An older looking Hilda, wearing an early 1980s punk outfit was sitting right next to Josie with an impish grin on her face. Joe noticed she had carSitting next to her was an Arab boy. Joe somehow remembered this kid's name being Andrew, and he was Josie's current boyfriend(Joe: “Yuck!”). Brianna Beaton was on the other side of the square table. She was a very pretty girl of mixed descent(White father, black mother), and between her, Hilda, and Josie, was probably the biggest geek of them all. She was wearing a black t-shirt with a picture of Frank Frazetta's version of Conan the Barbarian on it. However, pound for pound, none of them could hold a candle to Josie's older sister Martha, who was the Dungeon Master, in terms of nerd knowledge.

Martha here was about twenty years old. Joe had seen pictures of her at this age on her website years ago, scanned from old, worn out photographs, and now he was looking at the younger Martha up close in real life without her even realizing it. She's mentioned a few times that when she was a teenager she had put on the Freshman Fifteen in college, and in her four years had not managed to get rid of it, which Joe had mocked her for. Another thing about Martha that Joe was somehow able to recall from somewhere was that she now took to wearing glasses without really needing them, just to add to the nerd chic, and was wearing clothes that could charitably called eccentric on purpose just to freak people out. While Joe was examining her, Martha was being very snarky towards all of the D&D players, but especially towards her younger sister Josie, who she saved the meanest riffs and jokes for. Thankfully, Young Josie had learned to dish out as much as she took, and casually made several stinging comebacks while grinning look a fool over it.

Rounding out the group were two friends of Martha's from college who were both boyfriends.

“Fuck” said Joe to himself, impressed and in terror at the level of detail this false memory from a life he never lived was rendered in.

Andrew asked “Did anybody just hear that?”

Joe suddenly looked around the room. He was worried that he would be caught, maybe charged as a Peeping Tom(Or in his current form, a Peeping Jane? A Peeping Tammy? What do they call female peepers?) for spying on a group of underage eighth graders unaware.
14522121121211212121111111221122111.title: The Unbreakable Josie Macelroy, Part 1

145221211212112121211111112211221111.content:
*****

He didn't get a chance to have that question answered.

Now Joe was sitting in the passenger's side seat of a yellow Volkswagen bug. In the driver's seat was a now eighteen year old Josie Macelroy, cheerfully humming to, believe it or not, Redbone's “Come and Get Your Love” on cassette tape, Star-Lord's favorite tune from Guardians of the Galaxy. At first Joe didn't believe that this was really Josie, because in the four years between the last memory and the current one, she had evolved from being a barely pubescent girl into a young lady with a stunning and curvaceous figure. However, despite having model good looks, she was still dressed in bright, loose clothes that made her seem quite adolescent, her golden blonde hair still in pigtails.

Further memories suggested that Josie was studying to be a biologist, and she chose the university she was attending because it was three states over from where her parents and other family were. It wasn't that she wasn't close to them, but like Joe himself in his own life, she felt that she needed a fresh start, as well as a chance to “grow up” without the handicap of being in the same town you lived in your entire life. When she parked her VW in the parking lot, grabbed her things, and locked the car down, Joe was bemused at just how dated everyone and everything looked. The way the various students and faculty dressed and wore their hair and the way they conversed with each other, not to mention the prevalence of Sony Walkmans, suggested that this was either the late 1980s or the really early 90s. A catchy pop song that Joe didn't recognize was playing on a nearby boombox the size of...Joe realized that in 2015, nothing was quite as large as that boombox was anymore.

Joe suddenly found himself walking next Josie, who aside from from backpack was carrying a black attache case. She had a Sony Walkman on her ears.

Joe lifted up the earbuds to Josie's Walkman and put them on top of his own ears. Shockingly, Josie did not react to this intrusion at all. She still continued to discreetly dance to the groove of the music as if Joe had never removed the cassette player at one as she finally ascended inside the main campus building to the fifth floor stairwell and entered through the double doors. She even had a slight wiggle to her ass as the doors closed behind her.

Meanwhile, Joe was listening to the music, and it was indeed very dance worthy. The song sounded familiar, but he couldn't quite place where he heard it from:

You and me we're goin' nowhere slowly
And we've gotta get away from the past
There's nothin' wrong with goin' nowhere, baby
But we should be goin' nowhere fast

Everybody's goin' nowhere slowly
They're only fightin' for the chance to be last
There's nothin' wrong with goin' nowhere, baby
But we should be goin' nowhere fast

Joe put the earbuds back on Josie's head and pondered where he might have heard those lyrics from as she stepped through the empty room that Josie had decided was where she had wanted to go. She took off her backpack and laid it on the floor next to a barren teaching desk, and carefully arranged the attache case on top of the desk. She then opened the briefcase, and inside it was a bunch of comics and graphic novels.

**

A half hour of waiting later had Joe watching Josie lecturing a group of about ten people about comic books and why they weren't just for kids anymore. In front of her were issues of The Dark Knight Returns, Daredevil: Born, Batman: Year One, Watchmen, Love and Rockets, 2000 A.D, Marshal Law, Will Eisner's “A Contract With God”, and an upstart comic called The Sandman.

Joe was too young to have seen the comic book boom of this era, and was always slightly jealous of older fans who had read all of these groundbreaking comics when they had first come out. Now he had the chance, as he witnessed Josie's awkward attempt at forming a campus comic book club.

Josie was talking very enthusiastically and animatedly about these comics, as if they were devotional texts, but her captive audience, with three exceptions, seem nonplussed. One person asked why, between these comics and the recently released Tim Burton movie, Batman was becoming so dark lately, because all he could remember was the old Adam West show.

Josie went on to explain all about the Comics Code drama of the 1950s, how Dr. Fredric Wertham had stunted the development of comics as an artistic medium, and how Batman didn't start out as a campy crimefighter, but started out as a quite serious vigilante. Josie's style was that of less than an expert but a very knowledgeable and enthusiastic fan, and her lecture was snarky in a lighthearted and affectionate way. Joe was reminded of the many, many amateur game and movie reviewers that could be found on Youtube nowadays, like say JonTron for instance. Nevertheless, the inquirer still seemed confused, and eventually everyone but three left the room with the air of mild disappointment. The three who didn't leave were the younger Angela and Brittany Peters, a pair of chubby redheaded sisters who were giddy to find a fellow geeky fangirl like them, and a shy, contemplative, loner of a young man wearing glasses and a Castlevania t-shirt named Parker Sullivan. He introduced himself to Josie, explaining shyly that the name “Parker” came from Peter Parker. His father had ultimately won out in how to name their child, he explained, as Parker's mother wanting to have named him “Gully Foyle” after the main character from The Stars My Destination. Josie felt attracted to him, Joe could feel it, and she flirted with him for a while before they exited the classroom together holding hands.

That was the meet cute moment. From then on, Joe knew(How?) that Parker and Josie would be spending the majority of their free time together from now on.

*****

Joe momentarily “woke up” back into reality, disoriented by the constant shifts in reality, as Hildy picked up a blue plastic lightsaber and started play hitting Josie with it.

He looked around. The three of them were now in the Star Wars-centric part of the convention.

“Cut it out!” whined Joe.

“Step aside, worthy adversary” countered Hildy teasingly in her Janice Rand costume.

“Psst. Use my phaser” whispered Brianna, tossing Joe(sie) a plastic replica of the famous Star Trek device, which she caught, and began to play fight with her friends.



Option 1: While Joe struggles to find Angela and Brittany Peters while fighting to preserve his own rapidly blurred memory, he now recalls Josie's misadventures as a young adult and dating Parker Sullivan.

Option 2: Joe eventually finds Angela, Brittany and a still transforming Louis. He pleads to not have his entire life replaced by this Josie O'Sullivan person.

155332221.content:
A heavy fog rolls in as you and your friends approach the Schumacher manor. Well not your friends exactly more the girl you have a crush on, Sally, her friends and her jerk boyfriend, Chad. You hated Chad he was every cliche jock stereotype rolled into a single person. Your group hurried for the front door even with the fog you didn't want to risk being seen trespassing in the condemned building. Everyone is silent as you reach the door. You try to open it but of course it's locked. Chad just shoves you to the side and charges forward with his shoulder and knocked the door in.

"Psh, I can't believe you invited this dork out with us." Chad scoffs as he strolls in the old mansion. From the main hall you can see the damage from the fire that killed the owners.

"Give him a chance Chad. He's pretty smart, I bet he knows a whole bunch about ghosts and stuff." Sally smiles at you.

You didn't, not outside of what you read in a couple horror stories anyway, mainly because ghosts were nonsense. Still you smile back and try to convince yourself tonight will be fun anyway.

"Fine babe." Chad turns back to you. " Sorry I shoved you out there, I just needed us to get in before someone spots us." He extends his hand.

"It's alright" You begrudgingly shake his hand and Sally wraps her arms around both of you squeezing the three of you together.
You can feel the disdain emanating from chad at having to be so close to you, the feeling is mutual.

Suddenly the wind howls and the door slams shut behind you. The whole group jumps, the only light coming from the full moon between cracks in the broken roof. The old turn of the century bulbs buzz to life their dim glow giving of an unsettling hum.

"I thought this place was condemned, why is it still getting power?" Mandy, one of Sally's friends asks.

"and who turned them on?" Greg replied taking a step toward the door.

"Guys I swear if this a prank..." Emma scoffed.

"Well I hope it is..." Greg grunted as he pulled on the door. " Because the door is jammed"

You turn towards Chad, but even he looks spooked.

"Alright everyone calm down. This place is huge there's going to be plenty of other ways out, also it's half burned down so worse case scenario we have to risk the damaged wing and look for a hole in the wall or something."You say.

Everyone nods and Greg lets go of the door.

"Alright we should split up we can cover more ground that way." Chad chimes in.

"Right, I'll take Emma and Mandy and we'll check out the east wing." Greg.

"Ok your with us then." Sally says grabbing you and by the arms and dragging you next to her and Chad.

"Meet back here in around an hour." Chad says as Greg's group leaves.

You. Sally, and Chad explore the second floor. It's filled with dilapidated furniture, broken mirrors, and paintings of old creepy people. As your walking Sally stops in front of one of the paintings." Who is she?" You could see why Sally stopped it was different from all the rest. Unlike all the other paintings the woman wasn't an old crone, if anything she was quite the beautiful Woman, maybe in her early forties. She was wearing a long flowing black dress trimmed in a crimson red. A corset gave her body a hourglass figure and brought attention to her very large boobs. Her raven black hair fell well past her shoulders.

"That's Martha Schumacher, she was the last one to live here. The town thought she was a witch and a mob burned her house down with her inside of it." Chad explains the local legend. "She's the one we're here to see, they say she comes back every Halloween night looking for revenge."

"Stop it." Sally giggles as she pulls herself in close to Chad. " You're scaring me."

"Ugh" you sigh to yourself at the sight of them. You turn back to the painting of Martha. It had changed. Now the woman was smiling and had her arm around another younger woman like a mother posing with her daughter. The other woman was the split image of Sally. You quickly do a double take but the painting is back to normal.

"Just my nerves." You tell yourself as you pull yourself away from the painting. You look down the hall but you can't see Sally or Chad anymore. You call out to them, but there is no answer. You try every door you pass as panic sets in, but there's no sign of the others. Just when you thought things couldn't get worse, a voice in the distance begins to sing, You yell at your body to run, jump out a window, anything but follow the voice. Your body, however, is in a trance and follows the siren song. You walk down a long isolated hallway the lights turning on in front of you as you march forward. the voice is loud as you approach the door at the end, your heart pounds through your chest. You turn the door and find yourself in a cozy little study. A fire roars in the firepit,the room is clean of the cobwebs and dust that littered the rest of the mansion. the voice is coming from a chair facing a vanity mirror. You can't stop yourself you reach out and turn the chair around but there's no one sitting there. The singing stops and the fire goes out, your heart sinks. In the reflection is Martha starring dead in your eyes. She smiles evilly and motions for you to sit, your body obeys.

"Thanks for coming love. I knew one of you would hear my song." Martha says her voice kind and warm.

You swallow hard and say nothing.

"Every year some kids come along but they always run away before my work is done."

"What do you want?' You manage to ask.

"I just want to come back is all, I have so much work unfinished." Martha says. She lifts her hand, it's dripping with blood and she makes marks on the mirror that appear on your side of the glass.

"You're a witch! I thought that stuff was made up."

"No I was THE witch, the most powerful until a bunch of simpleminded peasants burned me and my coven, but that's alright I can always start over and you're going to help." Her voice was now cold and serious. She finished the blood sigil and placed her hand flat against the mirror. On your side of the mirror a ghostly arm emerged from the mirror and grabbed you by the chin. She pulls you in until your face to face with her against the glass. Her head lunges forward and you shoves her tongue into your mouth. Your body relaxes as she kisses you deeply, you don't even realize her body emerging from the mirror and entangling you with her ghostly visage.

You fall back into the chair your mouth wide open as her mist like form seeps inside your mouth.Your scrawny body burns like a horrible hellish fire, as you twist and change. Your arms thinned and daintier, your legs stretch longer, you shirt struggle against your changing chest. You stare helplessly in the mirror as you become more like Martha with every passing moment. your shirt gives way and rips open revealing your enormous boobs. Your ass expands, your hips widen all while your midsection shrink. You feel your manhood shrink away to nothing. The tattered ribbons of your clothes swirl in the air and coil around your body shifting into the black dress and corset Martha wore in the painting. Your short hair grows until it fall in front of your eyes blocking your vision. As the transformation ends you feel your hand brush the wild raven black hair out of your eyes and you see your reflection or rather Martha's. Your face was gone her bright green eyes stared back at you in the mirror. You saw her face smile and she stood out of the chair.

"MMhhmm, It feels good to be alive again." You hear Martha's deceptively angelic voice come from your mouth.

"What's happened to me." You try to shout but your lips don't move.

"I needed a vessel." Martha says plainly.

'No, you can't have my body!"

"Check the reflection it's clearly mine." Martha giggles at your torment.

"Please I don't want to be this way I'll do anything. Just leave me without a body."

"Anything?"

"yes anything please."

"Fine swear loyalty to me and be the first of my new coven."

"You want me to be a witch?"

"Yes or no dear."

"Fine I swear loyalty to you."

Martha smiles devilishly."Alright you can have this body It's served me well but I think it's time for something younger." The image of the changed painting, of Martha and the Sally look alike, flashes in your mind.

"No you can't!"

"It's too late you've made a pact with me. My magic binds you now." Martha laughs, you fall to your knees and the ghostly mist spills out of your mouth. You can control your body again or rather Martha's body now.

'This was your plan all along. Wasn't it?"

You just hear Martha's ghostly laugh. "Doesn't matter, you're my slave now. Prepare the girl's body for me, and any other of your friends', they'll make fine witches for my new coven. Oh and one more thing." You can feel her ethereal hands caressing your changed body. You shiver with pleasure at her touch. "Your on the dark side now, might as well enjoy it."
